intro: Erigeron obtusus, commonly known as the bluntleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are generally broad and rounded, with a soft, fuzzy texture. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
